summary: This is an email chain from April 2020 regarding the Epstein investigation. An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York informs a recipient (likely a legal representative) that the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility may contact them as part of its inquiry into the original plea deal, potentially to ask brief questions about victims' experiences.

persons.name: Gloria
persons.context: Mentioned in a correction within the email chain, likely the intended recipient of the initial message.

persons.name: Sigrid
persons.context: Appears to be the sender of an email forwarding a message from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the DOJ OPR investigation into the original Epstein plea deal.

events.title: DOJ OPR Investigation Notification
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney notifies a recipient that the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility, as part of its investigation into the original Epstein plea deal, may contact them to ask brief questions about victims' experiences from the initial investigation period.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was conducting its own investigation into the original Jeffrey Epstein plea deal as of April 2020.
The OPR investigation involved examining the circumstances of the initial Epstein investigation and could involve contacting victims or their representatives.
The communication shows ongoing oversight and review of the handling of the Epstein case years after the original non-prosecution agreement.
